sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
By the King. A proclamation, commanding all sea-men and mariners to return to their service in His Majesties Navy, by the 20th day of February next. England and Wales. Sovereign (1660-1685 : Charles II) Charles II, King of England, 1630-1685.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
printed by Leonard Lichfeild printer to the University, for John Bill, and Christopher Barker, printers to His Majesty, Oxford : anno Dom. 1665. [i.e. 1666]
Because the printers' name is spelled Lichfeild instead of Lichfield, "it seems likely that the King's Printers printed [this], perhaps at Oxford on a press sent down from London"--cf. Madan, III, 2731. "Given at our court at Oxford the 8th day of January, 1665. in the Seventeenth Year of Our Reign.". Years are given according to Lady Day dating. Arms 76; Steele notation: His doth deserve. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======
By the King. A proclamation, commanding all sea-men and mariners to return to their service in His Majesties Navy, by the 20th day of February next. England and Wales. Sovereign (1660-1685 : Charles II) Charles II, King of England, 1630-1685.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
printed by Leonard Lichfeild printer to the University, for John Bill, and Christopher Barker, printers to His Majesty, Oxford : anno Dom. 1665. [i.e. 1666]
Because the printers' name is spelled Lichfeild instead of Lichfield, "it seems likely that the King's Printers printed [this], perhaps at Oxford on a press sent down from London"--cf. Madan, III, 2731. "Given at our court at Oxford the 8th day of January, 1665. in the Seventeenth Year of Our Reign.". Years are given according to Lady Day dating. Arms 76; Steele notation: His doth deserve. Reproduction of original in the British Library.

the University
Christopher Barker
